result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:03 PM Defendant Daniel Lee Bailey appears from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson appears by phone,  ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions non-appearance, he had quite a bit going on and no vehicle. ADA Walker is requesting a $300.00 CB per request at last appearance. Court will QW. DE does qualify for PD. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:10 pm.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 10, 2021 at 02:30 pm.
DE in custody - E: DA & Email: Jail & Dispatch. eif

03:50 PM Defendant Daniel Lee Bailey not in court.  Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court: matter was set for 3:30, zoom link was up from 3:30-3:45 and Def didn't not appear. Hatch requests a warrant based on non appearance. Court: grants request and authorizes a warrant. 3:52
Plea hearing on March 2, 2021 at 03:30 pm.

03:57 PM Defendant Daniel Lee Bailey in court.  ADA Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Missed court appearance is addressed. ADA Hatch: no objection to quashing the warrant.  ADA Hatch requests a $250 cash bond.  Court quashes the warrant and reinstates the $3,000 signature bond. Court: another appearance is missed a cash bond might be requested by the State.  04:07 PM

Pre-trial conference on June 11, 2018 at 02:00 pm.

03:13 Defendant Daniel Lee Bailey in court.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant addresses the court. Froelich requests warrant quashed. Court quashes warrant. Defendant does not have copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives further reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Defendant pleads not guilty to both counts. Court rec/enters. Froelich requests $3000 signature bond. Court orders $3000 signature bond. 03:22  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 11, 2018 at 02:00 pm.
